alert.note: Alert for Allamakee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:08AM CDT until July 24 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL CLAYTON...SOUTHEASTERN ALLAMAKEE AND WESTERN CRAWFORD COUNTIES... At 1208 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles east of Lansing to 6 miles east of Harpers Ferry to near Prairie Du Chien, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Prairie Du Chien, McGregor, Marquette, Harpers Ferry, Seneca, Wauzeka, Eastman, Mount Sterling, Ferryville, Lynxville, Steuben, County Roads A 52 And X 52, Highway 35 And County D, Spook Cave Campground, Rush Creek, Giard, Harris Ridge, Limery Ridge, Fairview and Pikes Peak State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
